pullRequest.title: Fix of creating application in VSUP registrar module
pullRequest.bodyText:
merging of new application with user already in perun based on birth number in VSUP module now has to be approved manually by vo admin
at the end of approval of application the user external source is created based on RC for future merging of the user

commit.message:
Fix of creating application in VSUP registrar module

- merging of new application with user already in perun based on birth number in VSUP module now has to be approved manually by vo admin
- at the end of approval of application the user external source is created based on RC for future merging of the user

nodes.bodyText: This would create ExtSource with name RC and type as value of birthNumber. At VŠUP type of RC ExtSource is INTERNAL, we should have constant for it somewhere.

You shouldn't pass identity from application into the RC UserExtSource. It should contain login from the rc, like
new UserExtSource(es, 0, rc));
Message will contain toString() from the User object, which is not most user friendly way. I would prefer printing just displayName and ID.

commit.message:
Fixes based on review

- user in message changed to just displayName and id
- fixed creation of RC ues

nodes.bodyText:
Are you sure this should react to any exception? Because if there will be for example "InternalErrorException", this will say that the application can be approved if I understand it right.
@zlamalp should it work this way?

You are right, that we should fail at least on InternalErrorException and ExtSourceNotExistsException. Generally we should catch and ignore only safe exceptions thrown by the getUserByExtSourceNameAndExtLogin()
